title.narrative: Implementing the Global Manufacturing & Industrialisation Summit initiative

description.narrative: GMIS was conceived in 2015 through the collaboration of UNIDO and the Ministry of Economy of the United Arab Emirates (UAE). It is a strategic alliance that enables the establishment of a forum for dialogue between UNIDO and its third constituency # manufacturers # as well as member states. GMIS is a global forum aiming at promoting 4th Industrial Revolution (4IR) towards its possible benefits for inclusive and sustainable industrial development (ISID), focusing on advocacy and promotional activities. Ultimately, GMIS works towards a global consensus on the future of manufacturing within the context of the Agenda 2030, in particular Sustainable Development Goal 9: #Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization and foster innovation#. The purpose of this project is to support UNIDO activities pertaining to GMIS during 2019. Importantly, it purports to ensure high global visibility of UNIDO services with relevance to the 4IR at the Summit 2019, as well as during the Roadshow events building up to the same. The project follows successful implementation of the PA generously provided by UNIDO (EB/2018/9 # 17 July 2018) to establish a smooth and efficient process to ensure a successful implementation of GMIS 2019 for the period August-December 2018.
